STATEMENT OF REQUIREMENT/NEED 

The USGS National Land Imaging Program, supporting the Core Science Systems Mission Area, requests equipment 
equal or better than an Analytical Spectral Device (ASD) FieldSpec 4 Hi-Res NG 3 detector visible and near infrared 
(VNIR) 350-1000 nanometer (nm), short-wave infrared region 1 (SWIR1) 1001-1830 nm, and short-wave infrared region 
2 (SWIR2) 1831-2500 nm spectroradiometer. 
 
The primary use is for USGS employees to conduct high-precision and -caliber spectroradiometric field and laboratory 
measurements to accurately quantify, characterize and collect spectral signatures of Earth’s land, biota and water. Field 
spectroradiometry data will also be used for remote sensing algorithm development, satellite calibration and validation 
purposes. USGS employees will conduct these field research measurement activities with the spectroradiometer for 
comparisons with international standards and National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) material 
characterizations. Therefore, the field spectroradiometer must meet rigorous scientific analysis, scientific peer-reviewed 
standards (i.e. Thompson et al., Quantifying uncertainty for remote spectroscopy of surface composition, Remote Sensing 
of Environment, 2020, 111898) and operational accuracy needs.  The field spectroradiometer must perform to within +/-
1% of Landsat and other highly calibrated satellite mission data. 
 
The procurement equipment supports scientific research, civil Earth Observation mission calibration and validation 
activities on hydrologic, ecologic, atmospheric, mineral and radiative properties of the Earth. The procurement equipment 
bolsters the ability of the USGS to capture, process, monitor, record, calibrate, validate and distribute accurate, precise 
scientific data and records in a timely manner.  
 
In making this procurement decision, USGS considered alignment with DOI IT Transformation goals, alternative 
solutions, bandwidth and IT security impacts, portability, interoperability and life cycle requirements.  
 
Specifications 
 
Field spectroradiometer equal to or better than an ASD FieldSpec 4 Hi-Res NG Spectroradiometer is required with the 
following salient characteristics: 350-2500nm spectral range with 3nm at 700nm, 6nm at 1400 & 2100 nm spectral 
resolution, 100 millisecond scanning, adjustable collection potential via integrated spectroradiometric software, 0.1 nm 
wavelength reproducibility, +/-0.1% radiometric signal repeatability from 350-2500nm, 1.5m hardwire connected cable 
with 57 glass fibers identifiable across VNIR, SWIR1 and SWIR2 detectors, NIST traceable manufacturer, instrument-
specific radiometrically corrected detachable 8 degree field-of-view fore optic, NIST traceable manufacturer, instrument-
specific radiometrically corrected detachable reflective cosine receptor, 5m underwater fiber optic removable jumper 
cable, underwater instrument-specific, radiometrically corrected RadCal removable remote cosine receptor, cuvette 
aquatic sample holder assembly, coordinated Hi-Brite contact probe and Spectralon reference cap, portable NIST-grade 
spectrometer calibration illuminator lamp, integrating sphere, Mercury Argon NIST-grade calibration source, and a 
10”x10” Spectralon reference panel and instrument-specific wavelength calibration puck. The main spectrometer unit is 
under 12lbs and operates for extended periods of time at temperatures ranging from 0° to 40° degrees Celsius. Desired 
field spectroradiometer accessories also include: spare battery,  medium-duty tripod for spectrometer, and lightweight 
tripod for Spectralon panel. No more than 60 day delivery time.
